clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Assess the Safety and Patients' Satisfaction of Tears Again* in the Treatment of Dry Eye Symptoms
clinical_study.official_title: An Open Study to Assess the Safety and Patients' Satisfaction Tears Again* in the Treatment of Dry Eye Symptoms

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine safety and patients' satisfaction when using Tears Again to treat Dry Eye Symptoms.

primary_outcome.measure: Schirmer Test, Lissamine Green Test and BUT.
primary_outcome.time_frame: On enrollment and one month later.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: One, three and four weeks after treatment commencement.

arm_group.description: All subjects shall be treated with Tears Again.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Suffer from at least two of the following ocular symptoms: burning, stinging, excessive tearing, dryness, grittiness, foreign body sensation ( including patients suffering from blepharitis).
- Use artificial tears or any other treatment for these symptoms three or more times a day.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known hypersensitivity to Phenoxyethanol.
- Pregnant and lactating women.
- Receive other ophthalmic medication (except for eyelid hygiene preparations).
- Graft-versus-host disease patients.
- Participated during the last month in another clinical trial.
